autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor.name: autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor
autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor.short_desc: Number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze as a fraction of reltuples.

autovacuum_analyze_threshold.name: autovacuum_analyze_threshold
autovacuum_analyze_threshold.short_desc: Minimum number of tuple inserts, updates, or deletes prior to analyze.

autovacuum_freeze_max_age.name: autovacuum_freeze_max_age
autovacuum_freeze_max_age.short_desc: Age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent transaction ID wraparound.

autovacuum_max_workers.name: autovacuum_max_workers
autovacuum_max_workers.short_desc: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously running autovacuum worker processes.

autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age.name: autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age
autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age.short_desc: Multixact age at which to autovacuum a table to prevent multixact wraparound.

autovacuum_naptime.name: autovacuum_naptime
autovacuum_naptime.short_desc: Time to sleep between autovacuum runs.

autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay.name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay
autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay.short_desc: Vacuum cost delay in milliseconds, for autovacuum.

autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit.name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit
autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit.short_desc: Vacuum cost amount available before napping, for autovacuum.

autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor.name: autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor
autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor.short_desc: Number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum as a fraction of reltuples.

autovacuum_vacuum_threshold.name: autovacuum_vacuum_threshold
autovacuum_vacuum_threshold.short_desc: Minimum number of tuple updates or deletes prior to vacuum.

autovacuum_work_mem.name: autovacuum_work_mem
autovacuum_work_mem.short_desc: Sets the maximum memory to be used by each autovacuum worker process.

hot_standby_feedback.name: hot_standby_feedback
hot_standby_feedback.short_desc: Allows feedback from a hot standby to the primary that will avoid query conflicts.

maintenance_work_mem.name: maintenance_work_mem
maintenance_work_mem.short_desc: Sets the maximum memory to be used for maintenance operations.
maintenance_work_mem.extra_desc: This includes operations such as VACUUM and CREATE INDEX.

vacuum_cleanup_index_scale_factor.name: vacuum_cleanup_index_scale_factor
vacuum_cleanup_index_scale_factor.short_desc: Number of tuple inserts prior to index cleanup as a fraction of reltuples.

vacuum_cost_limit.short_desc: Vacuum cost amount available before napping.

vacuum_cost_page_miss.short_desc: Vacuum cost for a page not found in the buffer cache.

conclusions.Message:
[P1] Autovacuum is not well-tuned. The following parameters are default, meaning that autovacuum behavior is far from optimal for an OLTP workload leading to higher levels of bloat in tables and indexes, lagging statistics:  
    - `autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor` = 0.2 and `autovacuum_vacuum_threshold` = 50  
    - `autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor` = 0.1 and `autovacuum_analyze_threshold` = 50  
    - `autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay` = 20 and `autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit` = -1

recommendations.Message: [P1] Autovacuum is not well-tuned. Consider its tuning for your workload. The links below can be helpful.

Useful links related to autovacuum tuning:  
    - [PostgreSQL Documentation. 19.10. Automatic Vacuuming](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/runtime-config-autovacuum.html)  
    - [Autovacuum Tuning Basics](https://www.2ndquadrant.com/en/blog/autovacuum-tuning-basics/) (2ndQuadrant, 2017)  
    - [Visualizing & Tuning Postgres Autovacuum](https://pganalyze.com/blog/visualizing-and-tuning-postgres-autovacuum) (pganalyze, 2017)  
    - [A Case Study of Tuning Autovacuum in Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL](https://aws.amazon.com/ru/blogs/database/a-case-study-of-tuning-autovacuum-in-amazon-rds-for-postgresql/) (AWS, 2018)  
    - [Understanding Autovacuum](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GqrBp0gyNHs) (video, 55 min, Citus Data, 2016)
